intro: Chrysolaena oligophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Chrysolaena oligophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
